Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Amazing Service!”
Reviews.Author: GCPaul
Reviews.Content: From the moment my wife, child and I arrived, it was like we were royalty. The staff are exceptional and they are really talkative and always showing interest in our stay. Hotel Nostalgia is the place to stay whether on holiday or business. The decor and cleanliness is of high standard. We just cannot say thanks enough to all the team at Hotel Nostalgia.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: MrsRotty
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Nostalgia for six nights in April 2012. I cannot praise the staff enough - they were efficient, friendly and very helpful. We were offered a room upgrade at check-in and although check-out is noon, because our departure flight was late in the evening, our check-out was changed to 1400. The room was lovely - very clean with attractive and comfortable furnishings, though my husband found that his feet tended to hang off the end of the bed! The bathroom was very clean and beautifully decorated. The pool on the 3rd floor was small but in a fab spot - I enjoyed floating in the cool water whilst watching the passers-by below. The hawker centre just round the corner, Tiong Bahru Market, was fantastic for trying the local food - we ate there every evening bar one. Be aware that the food kiosks close relatively early - we found that eating between 1730 and 1830 was a good time. Just a couple of minor niggles - on the one night that we ate in the hotel, we ordered various tapas dishes, and were a little disappointed that everything was just deep-fried. We also found the mini-bar prices to be on the high side. All-in-all we thoroughly enjoyed our stay, and heartily recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: CoolArizona
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Nostalgia in April 2012. The staff are superb and cannot do enough for the guests. On arrival we were immediately offered a room upgrade without asking. Location wise it's away from the othe major hotel areas. There's a superb hawker centre in Tiong Baru Market just around the corner where you can get a full meal for S$2-S$3. Busses stop right outside and there are two MRT stations within 5 mins walk. The staff are always happy to flag down a taxi if you need one. The breakfasts in the hotel are superb. The only minor point was the remainder of the hotel menu which was all western food and very basic for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: trip_advis66
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights and can recommend this to other visitors. We booked well in advance and got a nice discount due to the time of booking and the length of the stay. Staff was friendly and efficient. We were moved to a nicer room due to planned repair of the nearby lift. Aircon was efficient and not noisy. Pool was very nice and clean. The rooms were clean and well equiped with a fridge, flatscreen TV, CD-player and a nice bathroom with a separate shower section. The hotel is located near to busses and not far from underground trains. The taxi found it easily.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel at a good location, but other options could be considered”
Reviews.Author: wtgn_ling
Reviews.Content: The property is located in a central suburb which provides easy access to the different parts of Singapore. And a very popular food market is just located behind the hotel, so if you are not a fussy eater and/or into the local cuisine, this is a good place to be. Our room was on the second floor facing the main road. We have been forewarned that there will be traffic noise at night. So if you are a light-sleeper, please make sure you get a room away from the (main) road. The room itself is rather small, so if you are a bigger-build person, you might want to consider other hotels. Definitely a no-no for two big-build people. For the price we paid, we would be better off at a hotel chain (bigger room). Otherwise, all the standard facilities of a hotel room are available. Toilet a tad-small but still ok.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for short stay”
Reviews.Author: AustraliaKel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently for one night - hotel staff very friendly and efficient. The room was small but well laid out and have everything you needed - LCD TV, fridge, desk. The bed was comfortable and it had a good sized shower. We had a window room but overlooked a side alley. There is a cafe/bar on the ground floor with outdoor seating. There are numerous restaurants around the hotel with the Tiong Bahru shopping mall approximately a ten minute walk away. The location is away from the main tourist area and is in a low rise residential area. The MRT (Tiong Bahru) is also a ten minute walk. Good value for an overnight or short stay,

Reviews.Title: “Best Service”
Reviews.Author: F-HWeinert
Reviews.Content: Beyond the clean rooms and the free upgrade this Hotel had by far the best service on our Tour through Singapore and Malaysia. Late check-out was free and we got a room to shower in in the evening because our flight left at 11pm, which was also free. The location might seem to be not central enough but in our opinion the location is great because taxi to chinatown and orchard road costs only 5S$.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, friendly people”
Reviews.Author: jgomezchia
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel to spend one night in SIN in our way back home, we arrived very late at night and people at front desk was very helpful to offer a different room away of the street to have a some rest., room was nice, very comfortable, with window. Breakfast is just OK at the restaurant, I recommend this hotel for a short stay at SIN or if you need to use SIN asa transit point. Be aware the MRT station is not close is around 10-15 min walking so i think is not the best option to get the hotel from airport specially with bags!

Reviews.Title: “Very small rooms, friendly front desk, poor management”
Reviews.Author: Snuffins
Reviews.Content: The room was booked for my mother who is in her 60s. She was placed in a twin room first as no doubles were available. This was tiny, the twin beds were only about 3 feet wide and the carpet was dirty. She was moved to a double the next day which was still small and had no window, but a much better size and cleaner. The bathrooms are small but usable, but the mattresses are very soft and offer no back support at all. Front desk was friendly, but did not tell us that the security deposit would actually be charged to the credit card used to secure the room, and I only found out after I received a letter from my bank informing me of this transaction. When I contacted the hotel, the person on the phone did not offer any apology or explanation and merely asked me to send the relevant letter to her and she would investigate. I will not return.

Reviews.Title: “A very unforgettable stay”
Reviews.Author: fibbllie
Reviews.Content: The staff there made it so well that we miss it every time we pass the hotel (we are locals and we live nearby). The room was tiny but extremely comfortable... Plus really gorgeous looking interior.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value. Friendly and Comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: Tryen
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights and no complaints. It was fantastic that we could access our room at 7.00am after a long flight from Europe and catch up on some sleep before starting to explore Singapore. Other large Hotel chains would charge for this! Rooms are small, but comfortable and not really in Chinatown as advertised but easy to get around and some good cheap food options in the area. Rooftop pool was a good for a dip after a steamy day walking Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “A nice change”
Reviews.Author: alpujarras
Reviews.Content: I only stayed one night at Hotel Nostalgia, but it is now on my radar for my next stay in Singapore. I have stayed in Singapore many times over the years. Always in one of the large hotels in one of the major locations - Orchard Road, Scotts Road, Clarke Quay, etc.. I didn't have time to get my bearings at this hotel, but it was such a great change to be in a more low key environment, away from the all the mall madness. I believe all that madness is easily reached from this location, with a metro station nearby and you could probably walk it too. What I loved was being surrounded by low-rise apartments, great restaurants and a food court and just being away from the hustle and bustle. The room was small but very comfortable and everything you needed was there. The bathroom was not at all pokey and you could move easily. And, as other reviewers have noted, the staff couldn't be more friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every way”
Reviews.Author: Amanda_McM
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with every member of staff unfailingly helpful and courteous. We were treated so well - from the warm welcome on arrival to the last minute breakfast to the meal prepared for us at 1 in the morning. Our room was completely satisfactory (the lowest grade) and the hotel was clean and well kept. It is convenient to the mrt - about 10 mins walk - and about 30 mins walk from the city centre. I do hope I will be able to return.

Reviews.Title: “Nostalgia Hoel is a pleasing thing.”
Reviews.Author: Oziemuncher
Reviews.Content: There are some basic things I like here - nice people - warm feeling- cold beer - just the sort of place that as you depart you remind your self to stay here next time. I would not be a tripadvisor if I did not mention the lack of power points and the need to be Houdini when carrying out basic bathroom duties. Close to good local food and as I am a 30 year visitor to Singapore it gets the tick from me.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: UHolm
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of nights and loved it. Small rooms but in general a good place to stay. The staff is friendly and VERY helpful. When coming back from Malaysia, having one day left before my flight later the same evening, they even offered to store our luggage for a day without charge. This being three weeks after checkout! That's what I call service out of the ordinary.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, very tiny rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Hershie
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on good reviews we've read, price and location. We were participating in CommunicAsia Expo. It is a small, relatively new hotel about 10 minutes taxi drive to Marina Bay Sands. Near the hotel you can find endless variety of places to dine in walking distance. Staffs were extremely friendly and rooms are clean with all amenities you might need for your stay, but: VERY TINY ROOMS! And we were upgraded to a deluxe one... Also our room has a constant noise from the building's pipes(?) So, not great for a q qiet good night sleep.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but not great.”
Reviews.Author: energymagic
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the beds. I love white linen and the pillows and beds are super comfortable. So I slept well. Bathroom is clean but super tiny. Hair dryer was dreadful, really slow and was very old fashioned, it requires an update. I managed with the small space but I really do like more room. For example I had no room to open out the suitcase except on the bed. And the only place to sit was on the bed. I had a tiny stool but it was under a little bench, in a squished space. I wanted to hang around in the room and I just found it uncomfortable. I did not like the breakfasts here and I tried 3 different meals and was disappointed with them. Also I would have preferred to be closer to the MRT. I think this hotel is fine overall but not enough to stay here again. As a side note: I have not been to Singapore before. I tried to find the hotel from airport by catching the MRT to Tiong Bahru station and then thought I would catch a taxi from the station to the hotel. This was on a Tuesday at 10pm I arrived at the station, went to the taxi rank where there was a queue of people. No taxis. Only one in half an hour. I eventually did find directions to the hotel as no one knew where it was. And jumped on a bus two stops and then very luckily found it. I was surprised it was so hard to get a taxi from a station.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel if you want to be out of the centre and a more intimate experience.”
Reviews.Author: Tony_Sandra
Reviews.Content: Avoid cheaper windowless rooms, but others are fine. Staff are very helpful, and sweet. Bar with outside TV screen for Premier League football was great! Location gives you a real Singaporean experience.

Reviews.Title: “Superb service, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: can1getaway
Reviews.Content: Booked the Hotel Nostalgia online based on previous reviews - and was not disappointed! Great location - easy 10 minute walk to choice of 2 MRT stations. Relatively quiet residential area with nice "local" restaurants and a great "food court" just steps from the hotel. From check-in to housekeeping, the service was first class - very warm and friendly and helpful. And they even had a laptop available for guest's use....which is fantastic for someone like me who doesn't own one. Room itself was quite small, but very functional and very well appointed with a queen size bed, luxurious bedding, robes etc. And I shouldn't forget to mention - a "rooftop" infinity style pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: sanderb022
Reviews.Content: Service was excellent, the entire staff goes out of their way to help out. Great location next to Tiong Bahru hawker center, one of the best in Singapore IMHO. Rooms are quite small, but are clean and well furnished. Definitely where I will stay the next time I come to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “small is good”
Reviews.Author: PerthScotsman
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem. Situated in a quiet area with many places for alfresco eating, good food laid back people and the hotel has the option of eating in their outdoor cafe. The rooms are small but perfect, no expense spared in decor and the perfect bed and shower. Staff are friendly and capable. I will certainly be back.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique newish property near Robinson Quay, excellent service with compact rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Buggalugs
Reviews.Content: I appreciated the feedback recently when we needed to stay a night close to Robinson Quay during the busy start to the local school holidays. Nostalgia is an excellent property, new, very well appointed, lovely bathrooms, with fantastic staff, we were sorry only to stay one night, we had to move from an adjacent older hotel on Havelock which was real contrast, suffice to say Nostalgia was excellent! The rooms are a bit tight, they still have a desk and wardrobe in the rooms and fine for one person for longer periods, shorter stays for two. It has nice outdoor and indoor dining and bar options. If you like boutique properties, it is ideal. Very clean and comfortable, the beds were great. A very early check in was not expected but greatly appreciated from the helpful and attentive staff when we moved from the other hotel. The complementary internet, very handy for that odd email.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with tiny, tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: Athing
Reviews.Content: Good service and staff but the rooms are seriously TINY!!! The smallest I have ever seen in Singapore and smaller even compared to NYC

Reviews.Title: “Great introduction to Singapore”
Reviews.Author: clivus
Reviews.Content: I booked Hotel Nostalgia as a last minute internet choice as I was flying out on business. I wasn't bothered about a city centre hotel and it wasn't far from where i was to work. It turned out to be a wonderful choice where the staff are extremely pleasant, friendly and attentive - especailly housekeeping! I suppose being a boutique hotel the rooms are rather small which was a bit of a problem with using it as a base for over 2 weeks but i was upgraded which helped. Rooms were very clean, beds wonderful. The pool was small but still welcome to cool down. It is also very close to a wonderful food hall full of a huge variety of local dishes. Downside? Not much really. A bit more expensive than I thought (my 1st time to Singapore) and in house food was not particularly cheap by the time taxes and service charge was added - especially a beer after a hot day! (again - a fact of Singapore it seems) Despite that I'll certainly use it again for the next trip

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: ZigeunerGreg
Reviews.Content: A great little hotel with friendly staff, well appointed rooms and fantastic beds. The pool is small, but was a great reprieve from the heat and the city. It's tucked away outside the tourist belt so a bit of a walk to get downtown. A sacrifice worth making, and taxis are cheap anyway. Around the hotel were some great local restaurants, a couple of convenience stores and no Starbucks in sight. :-) On the down side the room was very small, and quite noisy due to the traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Smallest Rooms in the World”
Reviews.Author: GazPerth
Reviews.Content: Had cause to stay at the Nostalgia on business, because the rest of Singapore was booked out due to the volvanic ash problem. Was put into a Superior room, which I must say was nicely decorated to a good level. Now it also must be said that reviews of a hotel can vary greatly based on the room you are given, so my review isnt as upbeat as other travellers. But this is because it was the smallest room I have ever stayed in. You could not but one foot in front of the other around any side of the bed and there was nowhere you could stand without bumping into something. Worst of all though is that the room had no window at all, which was another first for me. I simply couldnt stay in the room for long during waking hours, because you just felt so hemmed in. In terms of location you are in the suburbs which does provide good access to a range of local cuisine. But outside of that, there is virtually nothing surrounding the hotel. The hotel does have a small cafe but its all outside and the bar inside is very small. The service was OK and it was clear that staff do try hard, but at the same time it was all pretty basic. So overall the hotel is a nice boutique hotel that has been developed to a good standard. But beware if you are after space, because at least some of the rooms are the smallest, windowless hotels rooms in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Simply love this place.”
Reviews.Author: palifuk
Reviews.Content: Lovely small hotel. Excellent stuff, very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “home from home”
Reviews.Author: jmc186609
Reviews.Content: i arrived here on an unscheduled stop having been stranded returning from a world bar conference in sydney due to the volcanic activity in europe. my stay here was lightened and made enjoyable by the quality of my accomodation and in particular the professionalism;good humour and overall excellence of staff in particular but not exclusively in the restuarant slim,jay,amy and sagawat and lance who catered to my every need in short i was spoilt. finally while its unfair to single anyone out in a situation of all round magnificence i have to mention DIDI the front office manager who dislayed unparalelled patience,tact,and diplomacy in her dealings on my behalf with the ironically named customer service dept of quantus airline.she missed her vocation the united nations loss is nostalgias gain. in conlusion i should state the food is excellent, the decor tastefull;and the rooms while small are beautifully furnished.the complimentary laptop and high speed internet is first class .in short if you are going to be stranded on the wrong side of the world for a week then you couldnt be stranded in a better place if you find this little haven in less stressfull circumstances than brought about my discovery then sit back relax and enjoy even i did. john mc cormack galway ireland

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary Service in a Stunning Environment”
Reviews.Author: jgioiaherman
Reviews.Content: I travel A LOT. Our visit to Singapore was week 5 of a 6-week trip away. I can honestly say I have NEVER experienced the level of service that we enjoyed at the Nostalgia Hotel---a staff truly dedicated to extraordinary service. My husband lost the tip of his cane; the Front Desk Manager insisted on going to the hardware store personally to buy the replacement. When it was too big, she went back for a smaller one. All in all, she made three trips to the hardware store to resolve my husband's problem. As if that weren't enough, when I needed help contacting British Airways to arrange seats for a flight, the hotel manager, James Ting, called his contacts at the airline until we were able to resolve the issue. It took almost two hours! Then, there was their bed! Their bed was more comfortable than those I experience at the big-name chain hotels that pride themselves on comfortable beds. Because the Nostalgia is a "boutique" hotel, you must be prepared for much smaller room sizes than you were probably expecting, however the sumptuous appointments certainly make up for the small size. The food was excellent---far better than expected at a property this size. I particularly recommend this hotel for business travelers who do not need to be in the CBD and couples expecting to be out sightseeing most of the day.

Reviews.Title: “not so nice”
Reviews.Author: 44Woody
Reviews.Content: The rooms are defintly to small for this price. Rooms like a shoe box... We had a room to the street - very noisy. (no chance to change the room)

Reviews.Title: “A quality experience”
Reviews.Author: morga7
Reviews.Content: We've all learned by now that 'boutique hotel' means your room willl be on the small side. That's especially true for a hotel in Singapore like the Nostalgia, adapted from an original shophouse. This is about the only downside of this great little hotel. The manager and staff are exceptionally helpful and pleasant; the food is good; the new decor is pleasingly retro-funky, and best of all, it's at the heart of Singapore's historic Art Deco Tiong Bahru suburb, built in the 1930s. The nearby Tiong Bahru market has a hawkers Food Hall where locals eat: a good meal for $3. if you want a big room and easy access to Orchard Rd for shopping, go to one of big chains. if you want to stay in the real Singapore and be charmed, stay at the Nostalgia.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place”
Reviews.Author: reichman
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Changi Airport after midnight, and went to the Hotel reservation desk. What attracted us to the Nostalgia was the almost unbelievable 8:00PM checkout available at no extra cost. That meant we had our room for the entire day before flying out at 7:30pm, two days later. It's a 25 minute taxi ride from the airport to the Nostaglia. The taxi driver didn't know the hotel, 'cos it's only been open a few months, but he got us there no probs. Taxi fare was SG$25. Even though we were arriving past one o'clock, we got a warm welcome from the concierge, and that was the story or our stay there. Don't think I've ever stayed at a hotel where the staff are so uniformly friendly and helpful. The rooms are not huge, but very nicely appointed, with plasma TVs mounted on the wall, quiet aircon, free wifi and spacious bathrooms. There's an open-air swimming pool on the terrace on the third floor, a great bar, and a good breakfast and dinner menu available which you eat on tables outside the front door in the shade (complete with portable air conditioners - out in the open! Probably the greatest waste of energy I've ever seen). They even had bowls of fresh apples outside each lift inside the hotel for the guests, which was a nice touch. Just around the corner from the hotel is a fantastic food market. We went there on a Sunday morning to find hundreds of locals sitting at the tables, eating the food from the dozens of stalls. Lots of local and traditional fare there - seafood, pork and vegetarion rice and noodle dishes of every imaginable combination, and each prices around $SG3-4 per plate. But I'd steer clear of the pig's intestines on offer. But the hotel was great - comfortable and friendly, and an easy 15 minute walk to Chinatown, and just a 10 minute walk to the MRT station, from where you can get to just about anywhere in Singapore. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “A great little hotel.”
Reviews.Author: esorlegin
Reviews.Content: Recently, we had booked to stay in The Link hotel (see my hotel review and post in the forum). Our experience was not what was expected and so we crossed the road to a new hotel - only open 2 months - Nostalgia Hotel was a GREAT find. www.hotelnostalgia.co.sg The hotel is brillient - not a cheap hotel, but not expensive. Service is excellent and the staff speak very good English and are very friendly and effecient. The rooms are clean and very nicely furnished. We had a 'balcony' room - a nice place to sit and watch the world go by. Rooms are small - but this is common in converted 'shop house' hotels. If you want a big room go and stay in one of the new (international chain) hotels An added advantage is the sun deck and small swimming pool - very pleasant in the late afternoon. The location in Tiong Bahru is very good - there is a bus stop out side with frequent busses to Tiong Bahru Plaza (for the MRT). The whole area is buzzing with food places and the hotel is only 200 meters from the Tiong Bahru market. If you prefer to be in 'real' Singapore - away from the concrete high rise hotels and tourist traps then Nostalgia Hotel is a good choice. The General Manager - James Ting goes out of his way for guests. You can e-mail James at [-] We will certainly stay here again on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “too expensive and no service”
Reviews.Author: warmwinter75
Reviews.Content: with nice expection to stay in singapore and kind of disappointment with hotel, front office and housekeeping couldn't speak in english well. food price is expensive, room rate is expensive and very small. the swimming pool is too small to swim. one good point is location for eating out. a Japanese restaurant in the opposite hotel is cheap and delicious.
